summary: SVG path converter tool to convert SVG paths into CSS clip-path outputs with selectable conversion modes and previews.
known_issues: Polygon conversion mode output is not working (user reports polygon format produces no/incorrect result).
Polygon conversion fails on some SVG paths with curve commands (e.g., q/c): error "Invalid numeric value 'c' in q command end x-coordinate".

existing_features.title: Add an SVG *input preview* that renders the user-provided SVG path (`d` attribute) so users can visually verify the input shape.
Update the existing preview UI to support previewing *both* the input shape and the output clip-path result (e.g., via top-level tabs/segmented control: “Input Preview” and “Output Preview”).
Plumb the raw SVG path string from `ConverterSection` into the preview component so the preview can render the input SVG path (update `PreviewSection` props accordingly).

Fix the SVG path → clip-path: polygon() conversion so it correctly extracts polygon points from common SVG path strings, including command repetition (multiple coordinate pairs after a single command), implicit line commands after an initial moveto, and paths that include Z/z to close the shape.

Update conversion flow so a failure in polygon conversion does not wipe out a successful path() conversion (and vice versa). Show format-specific errors and keep whichever conversion succeeded available in the UI.

Make the Output and Preview UI resilient when polygon output is unavailable: disable/hide the Polygon tab when polygon conversion produced no output, and prevent the preview from attempting to apply an empty/invalid clip-path string.

Fix the SVG path tokenization/parsing used by the polygon converter so it never misreads a command letter (e.g., "c") as a numeric token, and correctly handles SVG number formats (negative signs without spaces, decimals, and scientific notation) as well as optional comma/space separators.

Upgrade SVG path → clip-path: polygon() conversion logic to be more universal by supporting additional path commands beyond the current subset, including smooth curves (S/s, T/t) and arcs (A/a), and by flattening curve/arc segments into a polyline approximation (instead of only taking curve endpoints).

Add a user-facing control to adjust polygon approximation quality (e.g., low/medium/high or a numeric “segments per curve” setting) so users can balance accuracy vs. output length, with a sensible default that works well for common icons/logos.

Ensure the converter continues to provide both outputs independently: clip-path: path('...') (a direct wrapper of the SVG path data) and clip-path: polygon(...) (approximated), and ensure failures in polygon conversion do not remove a successful path() output.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add conversion options: SVG path → clip-path: path() and SVG path → clip-path: polygon()/shape selectable via UI control.
Add preview for both input (SVG path) and output (generated clip-path) so users can visually compare results.

Improve SVG path → clip-path conversion to be more universal/robust across path commands (e.g., handle quadratic/cubic curves like q/c without invalid numeric parsing) for both polygon() and shape()/path outputs.

projectName: Add visual preview for both SVG input and converted clip-path output
